description.text: In this section, we’re going to ask you about the people living or staying at {address}.

list: Names of the people living at this address including anyone temporarily away.
Names of visitors staying overnight at this address on 13 October 2019
contents.title: You will need to know

options.label: No, I don’t usually live here
options.value: No, I don’t usually live here

contents.description: It means the address at which you generally spend most time. For most people, this will be their permanent or family home.
Full-time students, include yourself at your term time address.
Armed forces members, include yourself at your home address if you have one.

title.text: Do you usually live at {address}?

description.text: Include partners, children, babies born on or before {census_date}, housemates, tenants and lodgers, students and schoolchildren who live away from home during term time, where this is their permanent or family home

options.label: Yes, I need to add someone
options.value: Yes, I need to add someone

options.description: For example, this is a second address or holiday home
options.label: No, no one usually lives here
options.value: No, no one usually lives here

when.value: No, no one usually lives here

contents.description: We ask this question to help ensure that everyone is correctly counted in the census. This includes people who are staying temporarily or are away.

guidance.hide_guidance: Why do we ask this question?
guidance.show_guidance: Why do we ask this question?

options.label: Yes, I need to add someone
options.value: Yes, I need to add someone

options.label: No, I do not need to add anyone
options.value: No, I do not need to add anyone

contents.title: Include people who are temporarily away

list: People who work away from home within the UK if this is their permanent or family home
Members of the armed forces if this is their permanent or family home
People who are temporarily outside the UK for less than 12 months
Other people who usually live here but are temporarily away

contents.title: Include people who are temporarily staying

list: People staying temporarily who usually live in the UK but do not have another UK address for example, relatives, friends
People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for 3 months or more

title.text: Apart from the people already included, is there anyone else who is temporarily away or staying you need to add to {address}?

remove_answer.value: Yes, I want to remove this person

options.value: Yes, I want to remove this person

options.label: No, I do not want to remove this person
options.value: No, I do not want to remove this person

summary.add_link_text: Add another visitor to this household
summary.title: Household members

contents.description: We ask for visitor information to ensure that everyone is counted. This helps to produce accurate population estimates. Add any visitors, even if you think they may have been included on a census form at another address.

guidance.hide_guidance: Why do I have to include visitors?
guidance.show_guidance: Why do I have to include visitors?

options.label: People who usually live somewhere else in the UK, for example boy/girlfriends, friends or relatives
options.value: People who usually live somewhere else in the UK, for example boy/girlfriends, friends or relatives

options.label: People staying here because it is their second address, for example, for work. Their permanent or family home is elsewhere
options.value: People staying here because it is their second address, for example, for work. Their permanent or family home is elsewhere

options.label: People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for less than three months
options.value: People who usually live outside the UK who are staying in the UK for less than three months

options.label: No, there are no visitors staying overnight
options.value: No, there are no visitors staying overnight

contents.description: In this section, we’ll ask you how the people who usually live in this household are related to each other.
For the displayed household members, select the appropriate relationship from the options shown. The selected relationship will display at the bottom of the page for you to check.

question.description: Complete the sentence by selecting the appropriate relationship.
question.title: {second_person_name} is your ...

options.label: Husband or wife
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their husband or wife

options.label: Legally registered civil partner
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their legally registered civil partner

options.label: Son or daughter
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their son or daughter

options.label: Brother or sister
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their brother or sister

options.label: Mother or father
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their mother or father

options.label: Stepmother or stepfather
options.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their stepmother or stepfather

question.description: Complete the sentence by selecting the appropriate relationship.
question.title: Thinking of {first_person_name}, {second_person_name} is their ...

sections.title: People who live here and overnight visitors

contents.description: In this section, we’re going to ask you about the accommodation you live in.

list: Type of property, and if it’s owned or rented
Type of landlord if rented, for example housing association, council or private
contents.title: You will need to know

options.description: Including purpose-built flats and flats within converted and shared houses
options.label: Flat, maisonette or apartment
Caravan or other mobile or temporary structure
options.value: Caravan or other mobile or temporary structure

title.text: What type of accommodation is {address}?

question.title: Which of the following is your house or bungalow?

options.label: In a purpose-built block of flats or tenement
options.value: In a purpose-built block of flats or tenement

options.label: Part of a converted or shared house
options.value: Part of a converted or shared house

options.description: For example, in an office building, hotel, or over a shop
options.label: In a commercial building

question.title: Where is your flat, maisonette or apartment?

options.label: No, one or more rooms are shared with another household

contents.description: One person living alone; or a group of people, who are not necessarily related, living at the same address who share cooking facilities and share a living room or sitting room or dining area.

question.title: Are all the rooms in this accommodation, including the kitchen, bathroom and toilet, behind a door that only this household can use?

contents.title: Include all rooms built or converted for use as bedrooms

question.title: How many bedrooms are available for use only by this household?

options.description: For example, logs, waste wood or pellets
options.label: Wood

options.description: For example, solar thermal or heat pumps
options.label: Renewable energy

contents.title: Include central heating systems that generate heat for multiple rooms whether or not you use them

title.text: What type of central heating does {address} have?

options.label: Owns with a mortgage or loan
options.value: Owns with a mortgage or loan

title.text: Does your household own or rent {address}?

when.value: Owns with a mortgage or loan

options.label: Housing association, housing co-operative, charitable trust, registered social landlord
options.value: Housing association, housing co-operative, charitable trust, registered social landlord

options.label: Relative or friend of a household member
options.value: Relative or friend of a household member

detail_answer.label: Enter the number of cars or vans

contents.title: Include any company cars or vans available for private use.

question.title: In total, how many cars or vans are owned, or available for use, by members of this household?
